article.description: (20) NOTRE DAME 78, MT ST MARYS MD 64
article.headline: (20) NOTRE DAME 78, MT ST MARYS MD 64
article.linkText: (20) NOTRE DAME 78, MT ST MARYS MD 64
article.story:
SOUTH BEND, Indiana (Ticker) -- Chris Thomas scored 22 points 
and Chris Quinn added 15 as 20th-ranked Notre Dame held off
Mount St. Mary's, 78-64, to continue its strong play at home.

Torin Francis contributed 13 points and Torrian Jones came off
the bench to score 12 for the Fighting Irish (2-0), who improved
to 18-2 in their last 20 games at the Joyce Center.

Notre Dame outscored Mount St. Mary's, 40-27, in the first half
and cruised to its 16th win in 17 November games played under
coach Mike Brey.

Landy Thompson had 17 points as the Mountaineers (0-5) remained
winless under first-year coach Milan Brown.  They have yet to
beat a ranked team since December 18, 1995 against Georgia Tech.
